metadata.description:
This dataset contains the automatic weather station (AWS) measurements from Huazhaizi desert steppe station in the flux observation matrix from 2 June to 21 September, 2012. The site (100.31860° E, 38.76519° N) was located in a desert steppe surface, which is near Zhangye city, Gansu Province. The elevation is 1731 m. There are two equipment in the site, and installed by Cold and Arid Regions Environmental and Engineering Research Institute, Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAREERI) and Beijing Normal University (BNU), respectively. The installation heights and orientations of BNU were as follows: two infrared temperature sensors (SI-111; 2.65 m, south, vertically downward), soil heat flux (HFP01; 3 duplicates, -0.06 m), soil temperature profile (AV-10T; 0, -0.02, -0.04 m), and soil moisture profile (CS616; -0.02, -0.04 m). For the CAREERI installation: air temperature and humidity profile (HMP45A; 1, 1.99 and 2.99 m, north), wind speed profile (03102; 0.48, 0.98, 1.99 and 2.99 m, north), wind direction (03302; 4 m, north), air pressure (PTB210; in waterproof box), rain gauge (CTK-15PC; 0.7 m), four-component radiometer (CNR1; 2.5 m, south), soil temperature profile (107; -0.04, -0.1, -0.18, -0.26, -0.34, -0.42 and -0.5 m), soil moisture profile (ML2X; -0.02, -0.1, -0.18, -0.26, -0.34, -0.42, -0.5, and -0.58 m, 3 duplicates in -0.02 m).
The observations included the following: (1)	infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, and Gs_3) (W/m^2), soil temperature (Ts_0 cm, Ts_2 cm, Ts_4 cm) (℃), and soil moisture (Ms_2 cm, Ms_4 cm) (%). (2)	air temperature and humidity (Ta_1 m, Ta_1.99 m and Ta_2.99 m; RH_1 m, RH_1.99 m and RH_2.99 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_0.48 m, Ws_0.98 m, Ws_1.99 m and Ws_2.99 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_4 m) (°), air pressure (press) (hpa), precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m^2), soil temperature (Ts_4 cm, Ts_10 cm, Ts_18 cm, Ts_26 cm, Ts_34 cm, Ts_42 cm and Ts_50 cm) (℃), soil moisture (Ms_2 cm_1, Ms_2 cm_2, Ms_2 cm_3, Ms_10 cm, Ms_18 cm, Ms_26 cm, Ms_34 cm, Ms_42 cm, Ms_50 cm and Ms_58 cm) (%, volumetric water content).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The BNU data were averaged over intervals of 10 min, The CAREERI data were averaged over intervals of 30 min. A total of 144 runs per day were recorded in BNU data and 48 records per day in CAREERI data. (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2012-6-10 10:30. (6) Finally, the naming convention was AWS+ site no. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2016) (for multi-scale observation experiment or sites information), Xu et al. (2013) (for data processing) in the Citation section.

该数据集包含了2012年6月2日至9月21日的通量观测矩阵中20号点的自动气象站观测数据。站点为甘肃省张掖市花寨子站，下垫面是荒漠。观测点的经纬度是100.31860E, 38.76519N，海拔1731.00m。两个红外表面温度传感器安装在2.65米处，支臂朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm 处，并距离气象塔2米的正南方； 土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm 处，并距离气象塔2米的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6 cm处。本站数据集存放在两个表格中，其中北师大观测数据集时间间隔为10分钟平均，中科院寒旱所的观测数据集时间间隔为30分钟平均，具体观测要素分别如下：
（1）观测项目有：地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、 多层土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm）(单位：百分比)和多层土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm 、Ts_4cm）(单位：摄氏度)。
（2）花寨子中科院寒旱所观测项目有：风速（WS_0.48m、WS_0.98m、WS_1.99m、WS_2.99m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_4m）(单位：度)、沙尘浓度（Funjin_mgm3_Avg）、辐射四分量（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、空气温湿观测（Ta_1m	、Ta_1.99m、Ta_2.99m、RH_1m、RH_1.99m、RH_2.99m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、多层土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_18cm	Ts_26cm、Ts_34cm、Ts_42cm、Ts_50cm）(单位：摄氏度)、多层土壤水分百分比（Ms_2cm	Ms_2cm	Ms_2cm	Ms_10cm	Ms_18cm	Ms_26cm	Ms_34cm	Ms_42cm	Ms_50cm	Ms_58cm）(单位：百分比)和多层土壤水分体积（ADR_2cm、ADR_2cm、ADR_2cm、ADR_2cm、ADR_10cm、ADR_18cm、ADR_26cm、ADR_34cm、ADR_42cm、ADR_50cm）(单位：立方米/立方米)、沙尘动量（KE_Tot）(单位：计数)和沙粒子量（PC_Tot）(单位：计数)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：1）确保（1）北师大观测每天1440个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；确保（2）中科院寒旱所站每天48个数据（每30min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；4）花寨子中科院寒旱所观测项目的记录时间为世界时间，日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2012-6-10 10:30；5）命名规则为：AMS+站点编号 。
多尺度观测试验或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2016)，观测数据处理请参考Xu et al.(2013)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，其中假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况下。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观察到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观测比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散发（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组分温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组分温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。接着，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）及其在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中的蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）的比率，该实验是河西水文遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组分温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值很好地一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 在异质表面上生态水文过程的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而解决这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层级嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中，利用遥感测量蒸散发的挑战主要源于分离土壤和植被成分的复杂性、不同的表面温度、能量交换的阻力，以及像TSEB模型这样的模型的局限性，这些模型需要的参数和观测数据并不是从操作卫星和地面数据中轻易获得的。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there a need for multiscale observations in studying eco-hydrological processes over heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在研究异质表面的生态水文过程时，为什么需要多尺度观测？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: There is a need for multiscale observations in studying eco-hydrological processes over heterogeneous surfaces because upscaling these processes is a grand challenge due to the poor availability of multiscale data. The HiWATER experiment addresses this challenge by using hierarchically nested scales to capture diverse eco-hydrological processes, thereby providing more comprehensive data.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在研究异质表面的生态水文过程时，需要进行多尺度观测，因为对这些过程进行尺度放大是一个重大挑战，主要是由于多尺度数据的稀缺。HiWATER实验通过使用分层嵌套的尺度来捕捉多样的生态水文过程，从而提供更全面的数据，解决了这一挑战。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes errors in the estimation of soil and canopy component temperatures in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，土壤和冠层组分温度估计中的误差原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Errors in the estimation of soil and canopy component temperatures in arid regions are caused by classification errors in thermal images, uncertainties in atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance, and inaccuracies in the estimated incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy. These factors lead to an overestimation of component temperatures and affect the TSEB model's performance.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，土壤和冠层组分温度估计中的误差是由于热成像中的分类错误、大气上行辐射和透射率的不确定性，以及通过冠层估计的入射短波和长波辐射透射率的不准确性。这些因素导致组分温度的过高估计，并影响TSEB模型的性能。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential implications of using a high-resolution thermal camera for estimating evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用高分辨率热成像相机估算异质景观中的蒸散发的潜在影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using a high-resolution thermal camera for estimating evapotranspiration allows for more accurate separation of soil and canopy component temperatures, which leads to improved estimates of evaporation, transpiration, and overall evapotranspiration. This method can enhance validation processes through a combination of stable isotope techniques and eddy covariance measurements, particularly in strongly advective environments.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪估算蒸散发可以更准确地分离土壤和冠层成分的温度，从而提高蒸发、蒸腾和整体蒸散发的估算。这种方法可以通过稳定同位素技术和涡度协方差测量的结合，特别是在强烈的平流环境中，增强验证过程。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How do multiscale and multidisciplinary data collection approaches impact the understanding of eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert areas?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 多尺度和多学科的数据收集方法如何影响对绿洲-沙漠地区生态水文过程的理解？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Multiscale and multidisciplinary data collection approaches, such as those implemented in the HiWATER experiment, provide comprehensive insights into eco-hydrological processes by capturing data across different scales and disciplines. This enables a better understanding of oasis-desert interactions through a combination of eddy covariance measurements, remote sensing, and ground-based observations, facilitating the upscaling of these processes.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 多尺度和多学科的数据收集方法，例如在HiWATER实验中实施的方法，通过跨不同尺度和学科捕获数据，提供了对生态水文过程的全面洞察。这使得通过结合涡度协方差测量、遥感和地面观测，更好地理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用，从而促进这些过程的上尺度化。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the outcomes of implementing a rigorous data quality control process in the collection of eco-hydrological data in arid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区实施严格的数据质量控制过程收集生态水文数据的结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Implementing a rigorous data quality control process ensures the reliability and accuracy of eco-hydrological data collected in arid regions. This involves careful sensor calibration, data collection, and processing, which allows for the generation of high-quality datasets. Such datasets are essential for accurately modeling and understanding complex hydrological and ecological interactions in these environments, as demonstrated in the HiWATER project.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 实施严格的数据质量控制过程确保了在干旱地区收集的生态水文数据的可靠性和准确性。这涉及到对传感器的精确校准、数据收集和处理，从而生成高质量的数据集。这些数据集对于准确建模和理解这些环境中复杂的水文和生态相互作用至关重要，正如HiWATER项目所示。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the goal of implementing a multi-scale observation experiment for evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces in eco-hydrological research?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在生态水文学研究中，实施多尺度观测实验以研究异质土地表面的蒸散发的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal of implementing a multi-scale observation experiment for evapotranspiration is to address the challenge of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface, which is often hindered by poor availability of multiscale observations. This involves capturing multi-scale and multidisciplinary data through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 实施多尺度观测实验以研究蒸散发的目标是解决在异质表面上对生态水文过程进行上尺度处理的挑战，这通常受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的限制。这涉及通过在分层嵌套尺度上安装仪器来捕获多尺度和多学科的数据。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to use ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures in the estimation of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发时，使用地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Using ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures is important for better validation of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration estimates, especially when combined with observed ratios and measurements using stable isotopes and the eddy covariance system. This approach addresses the limitations of composite temperature separation, particularly in arid regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 使用地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度对于更好地验证蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发估计非常重要，特别是当结合稳定同位素的观测比率和使用涡度协方差系统的测量时。这种方法解决了复合温度分离的局限性，特别是在干旱地区。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the objective behind conducting intensive observation periods and continuous hydrometeorological observations during the HiWATER project?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: HiWATER项目进行密集观测期和持续水文气象观测的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objective is to investigate oasis-desert interactions and capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes by arranging instruments in hierarchically nested scales. This includes using a sparse network of superstations, eddy covariance towers, and automatic meteorological stations across different landscapes, along with intensive observations at the irrigation district scale.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是研究绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用，并通过在分层嵌套的尺度上布置仪器来捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。这包括在不同景观中使用稀疏的超级站网络、涡度协方差塔和自动气象站，以及在灌溉区尺度上进行密集观测。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodological steps are involved in ensuring the quality control and processing of observational data collected from eco-hydrological experiments in heterogeneous landscapes?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保在异质景观中收集的生态水文实验观察数据的质量控制和处理所涉及的方法步骤有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Observational data quality control involves several steps: ensuring the correct number of data entries per day, marking missing data with a specific code, removing duplicate records, deleting data that exceed physical significance or instrument range, and standardizing time recording. Additionally, instruments are arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes, and observational data undergo careful quality control throughout sensor calibration, data collection, processing, and dataset generation.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 观测数据质量控制涉及几个步骤：确保每天的数据条目数量正确，用特定代码标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，删除超出物理意义或仪器范围的数据，以及标准化时间记录。此外，仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行排列，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、处理和数据集生成的整个过程中都经过仔细的质量控制。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are multi-scale observational datasets structured and collected in the context of eco-hydrological research over heterogeneous landscapes?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，多尺度观测数据集是如何在异质景观中结构化和收集的？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Multi-scale observational datasets are structured using a flux observation matrix, which includes eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations. This is complemented by an eco-hydrological sensor network that measures soil moisture and leaf area index. Additionally, hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing is conducted using LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers. The data collection approach is designed to capture multiscale and multidisciplinary information from an oasis-desert area.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测数据集采用通量观测矩阵结构，包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站。此外，还配备了生态水文传感器网络，用于测量土壤湿度和叶面积指数。此外，还使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计进行超高分辨率的航空遥感。数据收集方法旨在捕捉来自绿洲-沙漠地区的多尺度和多学科信息。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What instruments and techniques are employed in the collection of data for evapotranspiration estimation using the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model in strongly advective regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在强对流区域使用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型进行蒸散发估算时，采用了哪些仪器和技术来收集数据？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The TSEB model data collection involves the use of ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, high-resolution thermal cameras, and eddy covariance (EC) systems. Instruments include meteorological stations that measure parameters like air temperature, wind speed, humidity, and radiation. The approach involves partitioning ET into evaporation and transpiration using the Craig–Gordon model, and validating component temperatures with thermal infrared camera data and four-component radiometer observations.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: TSEB模型数据收集涉及使用地面测量的土壤和冠层组件温度、高分辨率热像仪和涡度协方差（EC）系统。仪器包括气象站，测量空气温度、风速、湿度和辐射等参数。该方法使用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分为蒸发和蒸腾，并通过热红外相机数据和四组件辐射计观测验证组件温度。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What instrumentation and hierarchical arrangements enable the multi-scale observation of eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些仪器和层级安排能够实现对异质景观中生态水文过程的多尺度观测？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales, including a sparse network to investigate oasis-desert interactions, a superstation within the oasis, and multiple eddy covariance towers and automatic meteorological stations in surrounding landscapes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 进行了多个强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。针对绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置，包括稀疏网络以研究绿洲-沙漠相互作用、绿洲内的超级站，以及周围景观中的多个涡度协方差塔和自动气象站。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do technological advancements in remote sensing contribute to the collection of high-resolution eco-hydrological data in arid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 技术进步在遥感领域如何促进干旱地区高分辨率生态水文数据的收集。
Enablement.AnswerEn: In the experiment, 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer. These technologies enabled the collection of hyper-resolution data essential for observing eco-hydrological processes at multiple scales.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在实验中，进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计。这些技术使得收集超高分辨率数据成为可能，能够在多个尺度上观察生态水文过程。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions or methods enhance the quality control and accuracy of eco-hydrological datasets obtained from field experiments?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些条件或方法可以提高从现场实验获得的生态水文数据集的质量控制和准确性？
Enablement.AnswerEn: All observational data were carefully quality controlled through sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and dataset generation. This rigorous approach ensures the reliability and accuracy of the datasets obtained from field experiments like the HiWATER project.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 所有观测数据都经过了严格的质量控制，包括传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成。这种严格的方法确保了从像HiWATER项目这样的实地实验中获得的数据集的可靠性和准确性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might one anticipate challenges in accurately estimating evapotranspiration using models on heterogeneous surfaces?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么人们可能会预期在异质表面上使用模型准确估计蒸散发会面临挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The complexity and heterogeneity of real landscapes, which contain mixed components of soil and vegetation with different temperatures and resistances to energy exchange, make it difficult for one-source models to accurately estimate surface evapotranspiration. Moreover, the required parameters and observations might not be readily available from operational satellite and ground-based data, limiting the applicability of models.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 真实景观的复杂性和异质性包含了不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合成分，使得单源模型难以准确估计表面蒸散发。此外，所需的参数和观测数据可能无法从操作卫星和地面数据中轻易获得，限制了模型的适用性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of the data quality control measures applied in the eco-hydrological datasets collected during the HiWATER experiment?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您将如何评估在HiWATER实验中收集的生态水文数据集所应用的数据质量控制措施的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The data quality control measures in the HiWATER experiment are thorough, involving the calibration of sensors, systematic data collection, processing, and dataset generation. These measures are essential for ensuring the reliability and accuracy of the multiscale eco-hydrological datasets, which include a variety of data sources like eddy covariance towers, remote sensing, and ground measurements.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: HiWATER实验中的数据质量控制措施非常严格，包括传感器的校准、系统的数据收集、处理和数据集生成。这些措施对于确保多尺度生态水文数据集的可靠性和准确性至关重要，这些数据集包括多种数据来源，如涡度协方差塔、遥感和地面测量。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your opinion on the challenges faced in separating soil and canopy component temperatures in arid regions for accurate evapotranspiration estimation?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对在干旱地区分离土壤和冠层组件温度以准确估算蒸散发所面临的挑战的看法是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Separating soil and canopy component temperatures in arid regions is particularly challenging due to classification errors in image processing, which affect the accuracy of temperature estimates. The complexity of the landscape and variability in vegetation abundance can lead to misclassification, impacting the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimates. Despite these challenges, the TSEB model has shown potential through the use of high-resolution thermal cameras and careful validation against observed data.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，分离土壤和冠层成分的温度特别具有挑战性，因为图像处理中的分类错误会影响温度估计的准确性。景观的复杂性和植被丰度的变化可能导致误分类，从而影响蒸散发估计的准确性。尽管面临这些挑战，TSEB模型通过使用高分辨率热像仪和与观测数据的仔细验证，显示出了潜力。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do you perceive the potential of integrating airborne remote sensing technologies with ground-based measurements for enhancing multiscale observations of eco-hydrological processes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您如何看待将空中遥感技术与地面测量相结合，以增强生态水文过程的多尺度观测的潜力？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Integrating airborne remote sensing technologies with ground-based measurements offers significant potential for enhancing multiscale observations. Technologies such as LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, and multi-angle thermal imagers provide high-resolution data that, when combined with ground-based data, can offer comprehensive insights into eco-hydrological processes over heterogeneous landscapes. This integration is crucial for addressing the challenges of scaling observations in the HiWATER experiment.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 将空中遥感技术与地面测量相结合，具有显著的潜力，可以增强多尺度观测。激光雷达、成像光谱仪和多角度热成像仪等技术提供高分辨率数据，当与地面数据结合时，可以为异质景观中的生态水文过程提供全面的洞察。这种整合对于应对HiWATER实验中观测尺度扩展的挑战至关重要。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how ground-based measurements and remote sensing data are integrated for accurate surface flux estimations in heterogeneous landscapes.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白如何将地面测量和遥感数据整合以准确估算异质景观中的表面通量。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Ground-based measurements, such as those from eddy covariance systems and thermal cameras, are used alongside remote sensing data like LiDAR and thermal imagers to capture detailed eco-hydrological processes across different scales. The integration is achieved through models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model, which uses these datasets to estimate evapotranspiration and other fluxes with the help of component temperatures and energy balance equations.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 地面测量，如涡度协方差系统和热成像仪，与遥感数据如激光雷达和热成像仪结合使用，以捕捉不同尺度上的详细生态水文过程。这种集成通过像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型等模型实现，该模型利用这些数据集通过组件温度和能量平衡方程来估算蒸散发和其他通量。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m unsure about the challenges of conducting multiscale observations in eco-hydrological experiments.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在生态水文实验中进行多尺度观测的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: One of the main challenges is the poor availability of multiscale observations, which are necessary for accurately capturing eco-hydrological processes over heterogeneous surfaces. The complexity of instrumentation across hierarchically nested scales and the need for synchronization between ground-based and airborne data further complicate the data collection process.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 主要挑战之一是多尺度观测的可用性较差，这对于准确捕捉异质表面的生态水文过程是必要的。跨层次嵌套尺度的仪器复杂性以及地面数据与空中数据之间需要同步进一步复杂化了数据收集过程。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how data from multiple instruments are processed and quality-controlled for these experiments.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解来自多个仪器的数据是如何处理和质量控制的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data from various instruments, such as eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and remote sensors, undergo extensive quality control processes. These involve sensor calibration, data collection protocols, and data processing steps to ensure accuracy. The data are then used to generate datasets, which are made available through platforms like figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 来自各种仪器的数据，如涡度协方差塔、自动气象站和遥感传感器，经过广泛的质量控制过程。这些过程包括传感器校准、数据收集协议和数据处理步骤，以确保数据的准确性。然后，这些数据用于生成数据集，并通过figshare和寒冷与干旱地区科学数据中心等平台提供。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore and describe the data collection method used to observe soil and canopy component temperatures in heterogeneous land surfaces.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探索并描述用于观察异质土地表面土壤和冠层组成温度的数据收集方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The soil and canopy component temperatures were observed using a high-resolution thermal camera as part of a series TSEB model. Ground-based measurements were applied to partition evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration using the Craig–Gordon model. Observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 CST during the daytime, which were later used to calculate the component temperatures.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 土壤和冠层组件温度是通过高分辨率热像仪观察的，作为一系列TSEB模型的一部分。基于地面测量，采用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾。观察是在白天的07:00到19:00 CST之间收集的热图像，随后用于计算组件温度。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges faced in the collection and processing of multiscale observations in oasis-desert areas and suggest potential solutions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析在绿洲-沙漠地区收集和处理多尺度观测数据所面临的挑战，并提出潜在的解决方案。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges include the poor availability of multiscale observations, image classification errors, and uncertainties in temperature estimations due to atmospheric factors. Solutions may involve improving image classification techniques, enhancing sensor calibration, and using advanced models like the TSEB model to accurately separate soil and vegetation component temperatures.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 挑战包括多尺度观测的稀缺、图像分类错误以及由于大气因素导致的温度估计不确定性。解决方案可能涉及改善图像分类技术、增强传感器校准，以及使用先进模型如TSEB模型来准确分离土壤和植被成分的温度。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify and discuss potential datasets that could be used to investigate eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别和讨论可以用于研究异质表面生态水文过程的潜在数据集。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets include multiscale data obtained from the Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) project.
